title: Nicola Sturgeon still has a long way to go to persuade Scots to break up Britain
text:
If we listen overmuch to the SNP leadership and not a few media commentators – most of whom don’t really take much time to test the waters in this country – then Scotland is not just heading pell-mell for another independence referendum but also to leaving the United Kingdom.

However, behind the euphoria of last week’s SNP conference and all that crowing about opinion poll evidence, another survey has now shown that - while she may be successful in a general election - Nicola Sturgeon still has it all to do to persuade Scots that breaking-up Britain is a good idea.
